autofill.title: AG240 Dewalt XR PackFlash - PackFlash Plus - US - Teaneck

html.label: Intro
html.p:
Hello and welcome to our survey!
Thank you in advance for your participation.  This study is very important to us and we ask that you answer each question carefully and completely.
While going through the survey, please use the scroll bar on the right and bottom of your screen to move up and down through questions and images.  Please remember that there are no right or wrong answers.  We are only interested in your opinions.
Thank you again!  Let’s begin…

autofill.label: Months
autofill.title: Enter number of months here 1,3,6,12 for past purchased, BUMO

block.label: RecaptchaBlock
block.html: You are not human! You cannot proceed further.

radio.label: ln2_results
radio.title: Results

block.label: QualityControlBlock

title.p: Please provide an answer to this mathematical equation:

During this survey you will be asked questions with detailed instructions and it is important that you read them closely and answer honestly so we may understand you better.
This question is a test to see how well you’re able to read the question text and
instructions.
From the list below, please select only Reading Books and do not select any other responses.

radio.label: Red_Herring_4
radio.title:
This is another question to test how well you’re able to read the question text and instructions.
For the year 2024, do you project your purchasing behavior for each of the following categories to decrease, remain the same, or increase?
radio.row: For this row please select "remain the same"

block.term: Remain the same was not Selected

checkbox.label: S_PastParticipation
checkbox.title: Have you participated in a market research study within the past 2 weeks, on any of the following topics?

checkbox.label: S_Industry
checkbox.title: Do you, or does anyone in your immediate family work for any of the following industries?
checkbox.row: Advertising agency or Public Relations Firms
A graphic design or packaging firm
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of [pipe: Clutter1] products
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of [pipe: Clutter2] products
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of [pipe: Category] products

term.label: TERM_Industry
term.cond: (S_Industry.r1 or S_Industry.r2 or S_Industry.r3 or S_Industry.r6)

select.label: S_GroceryShop
select.title: How much of the household grocery shopping do you, yourself do?

radio.label: S_Gender
radio.title: Which of the following best describes how you identify?

number.label: S_Age
number.title: Please type in your age below.

select.label: STANDARD_ETHNICITY
select.title: Which of the following best describes you?
select.choice: Black or African American, or Black British

checkbox.label: STANDARD_ETHNICITY2
checkbox.title: Please select all of the following that describe you.
checkbox.row: Black or African American, or Black British

radio.label: S_Frequency
radio.title: How often have you purchased products in each of the following categories?

radio.label: v_FreqClutter1
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Clutter1] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.r1.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.r1.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.r1.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.r1.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.r1.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.r1.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.r1.c7: data.val=6

radio.label: v_FreqClutter2
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Clutter2] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.r2.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.r2.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.r2.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.r2.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.r2.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.r2.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.r2.c7: data.val=6

radio.label: v_FreqTest
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Category] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.TB.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.TB.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.TB.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.TB.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.TB.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.TB.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.TB.c7: data.val=6

radio.label: Q_SingleSelect_1
radio.title: Which of the following best describes how you use power tools (e.g., drills, sanders, impact wrenches) AND/OR non-powered hand tools (e.g., hammers, pliers, clamps, tapes measures)?
radio.row: I use tools at my primary job
I use tools at my secondary/ side job
I use tools at home but NOT for work or to earn a living
I do not use tools personally for work, but in my job, I have a role in tool purchase decisions

radio.label: Q_SingleSelect_2
radio.title: Which best describes your influence or involvement in purchasing tools for your work?
radio.row: I personally purchase tools for myself or others as part of my work
I don't personally purchase the tools, but I influence the decision
I neither purchse tools nor influence tool purchasing decisions

radio.label: Q_SingleSelect_3
radio.title: Which of the following is your company's primary focus?
radio.row: Commercial Construction (Shopping Centers, Office Buildings, Garages, Hospitals, Schools, etc.)
Government/Institutional/Education (Education Buildings, Public Buildings, Libraries, Military)
Infrastructure Construction (Roads, Bridges, Tunnels, Railroads, etc.)
Small Residential Construction (Single Family, Multi Family etc.)

radio.label: Q_SingleSelect_4
radio.title: What is your primary role at work?
radio.row: Office Support, Administrative or IT (Information Technology)

radio.label: Q_SingleSelect_5
radio.title: Approximately, how many permanent employees work for your company?

autofill.label: Employees_qual
autofill.title: Usage Past Purchased (P3M, P6M, P12M) - User/Non User for Database

checkbox.label: Q_SingleSelect_6
checkbox.title: Which of the following occupations represents the work you do?

radio.label: Q_SingleSelect_7
radio.title: Which of the following occupations best describes your PRIMARY occupation?

radio.label: Q_SingleSelect_8
radio.title: How long have you worked in your trade?

radio.label: Q_SingleSelect_9
radio.title: Would you say your clients are primarily:

checkbox.label: Q10
checkbox.title: Where do you shop for tools that you use for work?
checkbox.row: Auto Parts Stores (O'Reilly, Auto Zone, etc.)
Club Stores (e.g., Sam's Club, BJ's Costco, etc.)
Contractor/Building Supply (Whitecap, Colony, STAFDA, Acme, etc.)
Industrial Supply Distributors (e.g., Grainger, Fastenal, MSC, etc.)
Local Hardware stores (e.g., Ace, True Value, Other Local)
Specialty Tool Supply Houses (Electrical, Plumbing, HVAC etc.)

row.label: r1
row.autofill: Q10.r4 or Q10.r6 or Q10.r7 or Q10.r14

checkbox.label: Q11
checkbox.title: Which of the following types of tools do you own, purchase and/or personally use for work?
checkbox.row: Non-Powered Hand & Measurement Tools (Tools that do not require power, such as hammers, pliers, screwdrivers, tapes measures, etc.)
Cordless Power Tools (Battery-operated Power Tools such as drills, grinders, impact drivers etc.)
Corded Power Tools (Power Tools such as drills, grinders, impact drivers, etc. that plug into an electrical outlet)
Power Tool Accessories (Drill bits, saw blades, fastening bits, etc.)
Tool Storage (Plastic, metal, bag storage for tools and accessories)
Anchors and Fasteners (mechanical anchors, chemical anchors, powder / battery / gas / screw fasteners)

checkbox.label: Q12a
checkbox.title: Which of the following brands of tools + accessories, if any, are you aware of?

checkbox.label: Q12b
checkbox.title: Which of the following brands of tools + accessories, if any, do you currently own or use?

radio.label: S_Brand_BUMO2
radio.title: And which one brand of [pipe: Category] have you purchased most often in the past [pipe: Months]?

checkbox.label: Q12C
checkbox.title: Which of the following brands of power tools, if any, would you NOT be open to purchasing and using in the future?

autofill.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased
autofill.title: Usage Past Purchased (P3M, P6M, P12M) - User/Non User for Database

row.label: TB
row.autofill: Q12a.r1 or Q12a.r2 or Q12a.r3 or Q12a.r4 or Q12a.r5 or Q12a.r6 or Q12a.r7

autofill.row: TestBrand User - all test brands netted

autofill.label: S_Brand_BUMO
autofill.title: BUMO - User/Non User for Database
autofill.row: TestBrand User - all test brands netted

block.label: Quotas

row.autofill: (S_Gender.r3 or S_Gender.r4 or S_Gender.r5 or S_Gender.r6)

block.note: sitch is to set order for sitautional purchase statement in a 2.5Dv2 study - this must be added to the quotas

autofill.label: Usage
autofill.title: Usage Past Purchased (P3M, P6M, P12M) FULL LIST break out - netted where needed

autofill.label: BUMO
autofill.title: BUMO FULL LIST break out - netted where needed

row.label: r1
row.autofill: Q12a.r1 or Q12a.r2 or Q12a.r3 or Q12a.r4 or Q12a.r5 or Q12a.r6 or Q12a.r7

autofill.label: STANDARD_ETHNICITY_NET
autofill.title: Ethnicity
autofill.row: Black or African American, or Black British

autofill.label: User
autofill.title: This is "user" as defined by the insights team - the user by which they are running their data in crosstabs (and thus the norms)- this is defined as either past purchased or BUMO – as instructed by insights. Logic will be the same as S_Brand_PastPurchased OR S_Brand_BUMO.

row.label: Yes
row.autofill: Q12a.r1 or Q12a.r2 or Q12a.r3 or Q12a.r4 or Q12a.r5 or Q12a.r6 or Q12a.r7

autofill.label: SubGroups
autofill.title: This is used to capture the subgroups to be combined from Cat Rep and Supplements to be run in ART

number.title: Respondent ID

autofill.title: Findability Brand
autofill.row: DEWALT 20V MAX XR Cordless Hammer Drill/Driver
DEWALT 20V MAX XR Cordless Small Angle Grinder

radio.label: S_Omni_Research
radio.title: Thinking about the [pipe: Category] category, how much browsing or research do you typically do "online" and "in store"  before shopping?

radio.label: S_Omni_ShoppingPlan
radio.title: Thinking about the [pipe: Category] category, and the different occasions when you shop it, would you say your shopping is more planned or impromptu?

block.label: AgreementBlock
block.note: THIS QUESTION SHOULD BE LEFT IN TO ENSURE QUALITY OF INTERVIEWING AND THAT IT'S NOT A BOT TAKING THE SURVEY

radio.label: RedHerringCheck
radio.title: Which of the following is not a color?

radio.label: Agreement
radio.title:
Respondent Confidentiality Disclosure Agreement (RCDA)
Congratulations!
Thank you for agreeing to participate in this consumer study on behalf of Behaviorally. Before you can participate in this research, we would like you to understand that it will involve Confidential Information and you must agree to these terms and conditions. If you do not agree, you will not be eligible to participate in this study. By signing this agreement, you agree as follows:
You will use information or material disclosed to you or which may be available as part of this study only for the purpose of participating in this study, and you will not otherwise use the information or material for your own benefit or the benefit of any third party.
You agree to keep confidential and not disclose, copy, transmit, or use for any purpose other than your participation in this study any information or material disclosed or made available to you as part of the study, including about products or packaging that may be disclosed to you directly or indirectly by participating in this study. Any disclosure, copying, transmitting or misuse of any information or material in any form (including hard copy and/or electronic/data) whether intentional or unintentional may subject you to disqualification, and any other remedies available to Behaviorally or its study partners in law or equity.
You agree that Behaviorally (and its partners) will be irreparably harmed and monetary damages may not be adequate compensation if you fail to meet your obligations under this agreement, and that, in addition to other remedies, Behaviorally (or its partners) shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief to prevent any threatened or continued breach. The parties hereby waive any requirements for security for obtaining any provisional relief.
Each of Behaviorally’s partners is an intended third-party beneficiary of this agreement and each partner may enforce the terms of this agreement.
As further detailed in our privacy policy (https://www.behaviorally.com/privacy-policy), we take reasonable precautions to protect the privacy and security of your information during the market research survey. All information collected as part of this survey is treated in accordance with our online privacy policy and is destroyed 2 months after you have taken this survey. You will be compensated for your time, commitment, and confidential obligation.
Please confirm your acceptance of these terms by checking the agreement below.

row.label: r1
row.b: I hereby acknowledge and agree to the terms.

text.label: DateTime
text.title: DateTime
text.exec:
from datetime import datetime
cur_time = datetime.now() DateTime.val = cur_time.strftime("%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S")

survey.note: PROG: Only include QC Core Block1 if there is QC Core

block.label: ShoppingSection
block.builder:title: Shopping Section

pipe.label: continue_text
pipe.case: Please click the Continue button to proceed

block.label: RealEyeExercise
block.builder:title: Real Eye Exercise
block.html:
Hi! Your privacy and comfort are important to us!
You will be asked to turn on your webcam on the next page.
Your face and your background will not be recorded.
Just so you know - only the green dot area is being looked at for movement as you engage with our content.
[pipe:GREENDOTS]
block.note: Programmer NOTE: THIS RE_AreementBlock is for studies in Europe Only and is set FALSE for all other countries

block.label: RE_AgreementBlock
block.cond: Country.FR or Country.UK or Country.DE or Country.IT or Country.ES or Country.PL or Country.NL or Country.CH or Country.AT or Country.DK

radio.label: RE_Agreement
radio.title:
At one point in the study, you will see images and we would like to use your computer’s webcam to provide data that will allow us to analyze the movement of your eyes and their movement relative to the images you are being shown.
Please know - We never store any images or videos from your webcam. By analyzing eye behavior, our client Behaviorally can understand more about how people react to various images.
These data points will be analyzed by computer, and final data output will be mixed with those of other people who take part in this study.
With your permission, researchers from Behaviorally may view the gaze prediction data to check everything is working correctly. The technology used is provided by our trusted partner RealEye. All data is processed and kept securely in accordance with the RealEye Privacy Policy (https://www.realeye.io/about/privacy/).
By consenting, you agree to share the data points reference above. This data will only be used for market research and analysis purposes associated with this Project and will not be shared in any public domain.

row.label: r1
row.b: Yes, I agree and consent to participate

row.label: r2
row.b: No, I do not agree, and I understand that the survey will end at this time

block.html: Redirect placeholder so that the redirect executes

autofill.label: EF_Status
autofill.title: Real Eye: Status
autofill.row: Skip (I don't want to participate in this test)

textarea.label: RE_Open
textarea.title: Please help us to understand why you decided to not take part in the webcam eye-tracking test.
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

block.term: Real Eye: Skip/ Screen Out/ RealEye OQ

block.note: 25D_Shopping block is for 2.5Dv2 Shopping -This comes right after RealEye and HideDecipherShop block will be used to hide Decipher Shopping. Put close black for that at end of viruals

block.label: 25D_Shopping
block.html:
Please go shopping for [pipe: Category lower]. Select the products that you wish to purchase by clicking on the individual products on the shelf.  You may purchase as many or as few products as you like. 
Please be patient as it may take a moment to load the shelf.
To see a close-up of a product, use your mouse roller to zoom in.
To purchase a product, click on the product, click the arrow buttons to add quantity and click "Add to Cart"
To change your mind about purchasing a product, click on the "put back" button or click on the shopping cart to remove products.
When finished with the shopping trip, click the "check out" button on the bottom of your screen.
Please be sure to view the entire shelf before proceeding.

text.label: hiduuid1
text.title: record uuid
text.comment: This is a hide question, will be auto hide during the FW.

block.label: HideDecipherShop
block.builder:title: Shopping Section Hide
block.note: PUT THIS BLOCK AROUND Decipher SHOPPING AND VIRTUALS when there is 2.5Dv2 shopping

block.html:
Shelf Exercise Explanation:
In this exercise shoppers are asked to shop the test category as if they would actually be in their usual store, doing their purchases. For this, the category shelf is shown to shoppers again and respondents can zoom in on the shelf to see the products in greater detail. Shoppers can also click on individual products to enlarge them and either purchase them or put them back on shelf.

number.label: P_QuantityPurchased
number.title:
Assume for a moment that you are doing your shopping for Cordless [pipe: CategoryQ] products. Please select the products that you wish to purchase by clicking on the individual products on the shelf. You may purchase as many or as few products as you like.
Please be patient as it may take a moment to load the shelf.

div.ul:
If you would like to see a close-up of a product, hover your mouse over the product.
If you would like to purchase a product, click on the product and use the "+/-" buttons to add quantity and click "Purchase"
To change your mind about purchasing a product, click the "put back" button or click on the shopping cart to remove products.
When finished, click the "continue" button on the bottom of your screen.
Please be sure to view the entire shelf before proceeding. You may need to scroll over/down to do so.

[pipe: SHELF_IMG]

checkbox.res: IN COLUMN 2, PLEASE SPECIFY THE 1st REASON CITED.

I didnt find the product I wanted

checkbox.title: Product units purchased.

number.title: Quantity Purchased Per Product.
number.virtual:
D_val1 = 0 D_val2 = 0 D_val3 = 0 D_val4 = 0 D_val5 = 0 D_val6 = 0 D_val7 = 0 D_val8 = 0 D_val9 = 0 D_val10 = 0 D_val11 = 0 D_val12 = 0
G_val1 = 0 G_val2 = 0 G_val3 = 0 G_val4 = 0 G_val5 = 0 G_val6 = 0 G_val7 = 0 G_val8 = 0 G_val9 = 0 G_val10 = 0 G_val11 = 0 G_val12 = 0
if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r1: D_val1 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r1.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r3: D_val2 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r3.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r5: D_val3 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r5.val
if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r2: D_val4 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r2.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r4: D_val5 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r4.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r6: D_val6 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r6.val
if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r7: D_val7 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r7.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r9: D_val8 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r9.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r11: D_val9 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r11.val
if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r8: D_val10 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r8.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r10: D_val11 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r10.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r12: D_val12 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r12.val
if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r13: G_val1 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r13.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r15: G_val2 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r15.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r17: G_val3 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r17.val
if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r14: G_val4 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r14.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r16: G_val5 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r16.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r18: G_val6 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r18.val
if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r19: G_val7 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r19.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r21: G_val8 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r21.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r23: G_val9 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r23.val
if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r20: G_val10 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r20.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r22: G_val11 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r22.val if P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r24: G_val12 = P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product.r24.val
UBP1 = D_val1 + D_val2 + D_val3 UBP2 = D_val4 + D_val5 + D_val6 UBP3 = D_val7 + D_val8 + D_val9 UBP4 = D_val10 + D_val11 + D_val12 UBP5 = G_val1 + G_val2 + G_val3 UBP6 = G_val4 + G_val5 + G_val6 UBP7 = G_val7 + G_val8 + G_val9 UBP8 = G_val10 + G_val11 + G_val12
if UBP1 !=0: Units_BoughtPerProduct_All.r1.val = UBP1 if UBP2 !=0: Units_BoughtPerProduct_All.r2.val = UBP2 if UBP3 !=0: Units_BoughtPerProduct_All.r3.val = UBP3 if UBP4 !=0: Units_BoughtPerProduct_All.r4.val = UBP4 if UBP5 !=0: Units_BoughtPerProduct_All.r5.val = UBP5 if UBP6 !=0: Units_BoughtPerProduct_All.r6.val = UBP6 if UBP7 !=0: Units_BoughtPerProduct_All.r7.val = UBP7 if UBP8 !=0: Units_BoughtPerProduct_All.r8.val = UBP8

SPP1 = SD_val1 + SD_val2 + SD_val3 SPP2 = SD_val4 + SD_val5 + SD_val6 SPP3 = SD_val7 + SD_val8 + SD_val9 SPP4 = SD_val10 + SD_val11 + SD_val12 SPP5 = SG_val1 + SG_val2 + SG_val3 SPP6 = SG_val4 + SG_val5 + SG_val6 SPP7 = SG_val7 + SG_val8 + SG_val9 SPP8 = SG_val10 + SG_val11 + SG_val12

block.label: IAT
block.builder:title: Immediate Association Test
block.html:
The Immediate Association Test Explained:
In the immediate association test we want to find out whether the designs quickly and intuitively convey key attributes within a competitive context. For this, respondents are shown the test product and two key competitors. For each statement or attribute, respondents are given 6 seconds (maximum) to choose which product / brand best applies to the statement.
block.note: PROGRAMMER NOTE: 0 is neutral, 00 is fair DO NOT need to be captured in the summary table - - 1 is unique and different from other brands is the FIRST data point captured here

checkbox.label: vIM1B
checkbox.title: Test IAT Summary Table
checkbox.virtual:
if IM1B_1.c1: vIM1B.r1.c1.val=1 if IM1B_1.c2: vIM1B.r1.c2.val=1
if IM1B_2.c1: vIM1B.r2.c1.val=1 if IM1B_2.c2: vIM1B.r2.c2.val=1
if IM1B_3.c1: vIM1B.r3.c1.val=1 if IM1B_3.c2: vIM1B.r3.c2.val=1
if IM1B_4.c1: vIM1B.r4.c1.val=1 if IM1B_4.c2: vIM1B.r4.c2.val=1
if IM1B_5.c1: vIM1B.r5.c1.val=1 if IM1B_5.c2: vIM1B.r5.c2.val=1
if IM1B_6.c1: vIM1B.r6.c1.val=1 if IM1B_6.c2: vIM1B.r6.c2.val=1
if IM1B_7.c1: vIM1B.r7.c1.val=1 if IM1B_7.c2: vIM1B.r7.c2.val=1
if IM1B_8.c1: vIM1B.r8.c1.val=1 if IM1B_8.c2: vIM1B.r8.c2.val=1
if IM1B_9.c1: vIM1B.r9.c1.val=1 if IM1B_9.c2: vIM1B.r9.c2.val=1
if IM1B_10.c1: vIM1B.r10.c1.val=1 if IM1B_10.c2: vIM1B.r10.c2.val=1
if IM1B_11.c1: vIM1B.r11.c1.val=1 if IM1B_11.c2: vIM1B.r11.c2.val=1
if not(data.c1.any): vIM1B.r99.c1.val=1 if not(data.c2.any): vIM1B.r99.c2.val=1
checkbox.row: Is unique and different from other brands
Confidence to get the job done
Did not choose product for any statement
checkbox.col: Milwaukee M18 FUEL Cordless Hammer Drill/Driver

html.label: IM1
html.span:
You are now going to see another series of statements and products on your screen.
Please pay attention as it's going to be very quick.
As soon as a statement appears you will have 5 seconds to click on the product that best fits with the statement.
Ready? Please continue.

block.label: b1a
block.builder:title: default loop block

radio.label: IM1B_[loopvar: label]

float.label: packAttTimesnlivea_[loopvar: label]
float.title: Pack Attribute Times
float.exec: for row in packAttTimesa_[loopvar: label].rows: packAttTimesnlivea_[loopvar: label].rows[row.index].val = float(packAttTimesa_[loopvar: label].rows[row.index].val or 0)

block.note: Is Unique and different from other brands is a Plus standard statement and should always be in position 1

textarea.label: IM2_[loopvar: label]
textarea.title: What specifically about the [pipe: Brand] made you say it was "[loopvar:statement]" than the others?

block.note: PROGRAMMER NOTE: 0 is neutral, 00 is fair, and 1 is unique and different from other brands need to remain in IAT for all studies and not edited.

looprow.loopvar: Is unique and different from other brands
Confidence to get the job done

block.label: SituationalPurchasedBlock
block.html:
Thank you for your [pipe: purchase_autofill]. On the next few screens you will see the [pipe: Category] products on shelf again.
For each of the following situations, please select the single item that best fits the situation.

number.label: Scenario1
number.title: Now, please shop again, and this time please buy a single item that [pipe: proposition1].

number.label: Scenario2
number.title: Now, please shop again, and this time please buy a single item that [pipe: proposition2].

checkbox.label: Scenario1_Picked
checkbox.title: Scenario 1 Product Picked

checkbox.label: Scenario2_Picked
checkbox.title: Scenario 2 Product Picked

block.label: FlashExposure
block.html: You are now going to be shown a picture on the screen. Please pay attention as it’s going to be a very short exposure.

checkbox.label: F_Practice
checkbox.title: Please review the image below. After 1/2 seconds, you will automatically be advanced to the next page.

textarea.label: F_Practice_OE
textarea.title: Please describe everything you saw, even if you are not sure about it.
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

block.html: You are now going to be shown another picture on the screen. Please pay attention as it’s going to be a very short exposure.

checkbox.label: F_Flash1
checkbox.title: Please review the image below. After 1.5 seconds, you will automatically be advanced to the next page.

textarea.label: F_Flash1_OE
textarea.title: Please describe everything you saw, even if you are not sure about it.
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

block.note: REMOVING FLASH 2 from all PF. Aug 1, 2022 as per new architecture
Flash 2 may have been left in here for historical architecture but is now turned false - will delete soon April 12 2023
PROGRAMMER NOTE: IF Fit, Und and Usual are included - they must be choice 1, 2, 3 and NOT randomized. Labels must stay as is for Norms
PROGRAMMER NOTE: Usual - ask if Past buyers Past purchased selectes Test Brand -- logic is built in: cond="S_Brand_PastPurchased.TB"

radio.label: F_Flash3
radio.title: How much do you agree or disagree that the following phrases apply to this product based on what you have just seen.

ul.ul:
10 means that you strongly agree with the statement
1 means that you strongly disagree with the statement

div.strong: You may choose any number from 1 to 10 that best describes your opinion.

strong.span: Based on what you have just seen, would you say that….

radio.row: The packaging fits very well with what I expect from [pipe: CategoryQ] products
It is easy to understand what product it is
You recognize this as your usual product/brand
Is more powerful than other options

radio.label: Straightliner_Flash3
radio.title: DO NOT REMOVE OR MODIFY - Straightliner Punch - Just Tracking for Flash3

block.label: Findability_Section
block.builder:title: Findability Section
block.html:
Next, you are going to see the display of [pipe: CategoryQ] products again.
This time, you will be looking for one particular item.
When you see the display, Please find [pipe: Finda].
When you find this product, use your mouse and click on the center of the product to select it.
When you are ready, click continue to begin.

number.label: F1
number.title:
Again, you are looking for:
[pipe: Finda upper]

radio.label: F1_Item_Found
radio.title: Product Found

radio.label: vFindCorrect
radio.exec: if F1.c1.r2.val >0 or F1.c1.r4.val >0 or F1.c1.r6.val >0 or F1.c1.r14.val >0 or F1.c1.r16.val >0 or F1.c1.r18.val >0: vFindCorrect.val = 0 else: vFindCorrect.val = 1

block.note: Findability Question Bank: Differentiation are OPTIONAL

block.label: DoNotModifyDataBase
block.builder:title: Do Not Modify - for DataBaseCollection

autofill.label: CorrectlyFound
autofill.title: Correctly Found - Was the Respondent a TestBrand User (based off of Usage)

radio.label: EaseOfFind
radio.title: How easy or difficult do you think it was to find this product?
radio.row: Neither easy nor difficult to find

block.note: DO NOT MODIFY: EaseOfFind - Filtered by Correctly Located

radio.label: vEaseOfFind
radio.title: DO NOT MODIFY: EaseOfFind - Filtered by Correctly Located How easy or difficult do you think it was to find this product?
radio.row: Neither easy nor difficult to find

textarea.label: F_Highlight_[loopvar: label]
textarea.title: When finding [pipe: Finda], which one part of the packaging was most useful in helping you find what you were looking for?
textarea.comment: Using your mouse, highlight the single part of the packaging that was most useful.

block.label: Attitudinal
block.html:
Areas of Appeal Exercise:
PROGRAMMER: Show stimuli according to the phase as indicated below:

You are now going to see the picture of a pack. On that picture, you will be asked to highlight the areas you like most about the pack, if there are any.
Then on that same picture, you will be asked to highlight the areas you dislike about the pack, if any.

textarea.label: Q_Likes_[loopvar: label]
textarea.title: Using your mouse, please highlight the items/aspects of the packaging you like most (if any). If there's nothing that you specifically like, please click "I don’t like any of it" at the bottom of the page.
textarea.validate: if Q_Likes_[loopvar: label].c1.val != "" and Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1: error(res.MapError) if Q_Likes_[loopvar: label].c1.val == "" and not(Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1): error(res.MapError2)

checkbox.label: Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label]
checkbox.validate: if Q_Likes_[loopvar: label].c1.val != "" and Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1: error(res.MapError) if Q_Likes_[loopvar: label].c1.val == "" and not(Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1): error(res.MapError2)
checkbox.row: I don’t like any of it

textarea.label: Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label]
textarea.title: Using your mouse, please highlight the items/aspects of the packaging you dislike (if any). If there's nothing that you specifically dislike, please click "I don’t dislike any of it" at the bottom of the page.
textarea.validate: if Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label].c1.val != "" and Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1: error(res.MapError) if Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label].c1.val == "" and not(Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1): error(res.MapError2)

checkbox.label: Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label]
checkbox.validate: if Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label].c1.val != "" and Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1: error(res.MapError) if Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label].c1.val == "" and not(Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1): error(res.MapError2)
checkbox.row: I don’t dislike any of it

block.note: Attitudinal Question Bank Part 3: FamilyFit, Q_Benefit, Benefit_OE, PricePerception Block are optional

radio.label: FamilyFit
radio.title: How well do the [pipe: Brand] products fit together as a family?

block.html:
For the next few questions, please focus your attention on the [pipe: Brand] packaging you see here.
[pipe: PH_IMG]

textarea.label: Q_InitialImpressions
textarea.title: Based on what this [pipe:Brand] packaging shows and tells you, what are your impressions of these products? What, if anything, is different about this product relative to others in the category?
textarea.comment:
[pipe: PH_IMG]
Please be as detailed and thorough as possible and indicate whether your response is positive or negative in nature.

radio.label: Q_OA
radio.title: How much do you like or dislike the [pipe: Brand] packaging?

checkbox.label: Q_PackAtt
checkbox.title: You will now see some words and phrases that could be used to describe the appearance of various products. Do you think the [pipe: Brand] packaging is…

radio.label: Q_Communication
radio.title: [pipe: PH_IMG]
radio.comment:
How much do you agree or disagree that the following phrases apply to this [pipe: Brand] product?
This [pipe: Brand] product…
radio.row: Is made by a brand I can trust

radio.label: Straightliner
radio.title: DO NOT REMOVE OR MODIFY - Straightliner Punch

radio.label: Q_PI
radio.title: How likely would you be to buy this [pipe: Brand] product, if it was available for the price below?

radio.label: Differentiation
radio.title: How easy or difficult do you think it is to tell the difference between these [pipe: Brand] products?
radio.row: Very easy to tell the difference
Somewhat easy to tell the difference
Neither easy nor difficult to tell the difference
Somewhat difficult to tell the difference
Very difficult to tell the difference

strong.em: Now, just a few questions for classification purposes…

select.label: S_State
select.title: Please select the US state in which you currently live.

select.label: C_Employment
select.title: Which of the following best describes your current employment status?

select.label: STANDARD_EDUCATION
select.title: What is the highest level of education you have completed?
select.choice: Other post high school vocational training
Completed some college, but no degree
Completed some graduate, but no degree

select.label: STANDARD_INCOME
select.title: Please select the range that best represents your total annual household income.

radio.label: S_Recontact_Will
radio.title:
You are eligible to participate in a follow-up online market research discussion on consumer products. This is not an attempt to sell you anything -- this is strictly a research study. This is also an opportunity to express your thoughts, opinions and ideas to a company that is interested in what you have to say.
The 15 to 20 minute discussion would take place over a live online video call with a certified moderator, and would require you to use a laptop or desktop computer (not a mobile device or tablet). You will receive an additional incentive of [pipe: QualPrice] for participating in this discussion.
If selected, you will be notified within 1 week, at which point you will receive details regarding when the discussion will take place. Would you be willing to participate?

radio.label: S_Recontact_CAM
radio.title: Does your laptop or desktop computer have a functioning web cam?

radio.label: S_Recontact_SPEED
radio.title: Please select the response that best describes your internet connection.
radio.row: High-Performance Internet (any service faster than standard Cable)

text.label: S_Recontact_INFO
text.cond: not(gv.isSST()) and (S_Recontact_SPEED.r2 or S_Recontact_SPEED.r3 or S_Recontact_SPEED.r4)
text.title: Please provide your contact information so that we may contact you if selected.

radio.label: S_Recontact_TimeZone
radio.title: Please select your time zone.

html.label: S_Recontact_End
html.cond: not(gv.isSST()) and (S_Recontact_SPEED.r2 or S_Recontact_SPEED.r3 or S_Recontact_SPEED.r4)
html.strong:
Thank you for this information!
Thank you for participation! You have been determined eligible for the online discussion mentioned earlier. If selected, we will contact you within 1 week, at which point you will receive details regarding when the discussion will take place.
